name: Iliac Artery Aneurysm with Partial Thrombosis
chief_complaint: I have a throbbing pain in my lower abdomen that radiates to my back, and my left leg feels weak.
physical_findings: palpable pulsatile mass in lower abdomen
prognosis: Good with timely intervention, but risk of rupture without treatment
description: A localized dilation of the iliac artery exceeding 1.5x normal diameter with partial thrombosis. The condition carries risk of rupture or distal embolism. Most common in elderly males with atherosclerosis.
multiple_choice: Iliac Artery Aneurysm with Partial Thrombosis
